## Security

-   Know your ToS
-   Don't allow use for model improvement
    -   *ChatGPT: Settings \> Data Controls \> Improve The Model for Everyone:* **Off**
    -   *Claude: Settings \> Privacy \> Help Improve Claude:* **Off**
    -   *Gemini: Google Account \> Gemini Apps Activity \> Improve Google service:* **Unchecked**
-   Even when secure, avoid passing raw deidentified data to LLM

## Exercise 1

**Code Explanation**

Search for and copy code from [GitHub](https://github.com/) and ask the LLM for a detailed explanation for what libraries and packages are being used and what code accomplishes.

{{< countdown "10:00" >}}

## Exercise 2

**Screening for Clinical Trials**

Search for a kidney-related active trial on [clinicaltrials.gov](https://clinicaltrials.gov/) and copy the Participation Criteria. Ask the LLM to write code to identify patients in your database eligible for the trial.

[Example Trial Participation Criteria](https://clinicaltrials.gov/study/NCT05638880?cond=Kidney%20Diseases&aggFilters=status:rec&rank=1#participation-criteria)

{{< countdown "10:00" >}}

## Exercise 3

**Visualization and Predictive Modeling**

Using the following description of the clinical trial, copy and paste the variables and data descriptions into an LLM and ask it to:

1\. Create a *JAMA* style Table 1 in Markdown.

2\. Provide and explain code for building multiple predictive models for `remission` (remission = 1).

3\. Optional: Download the dataset and evaluate the code in Google Colab.

## Bonus Exercise

**Handling Messy Data**

Use an LLM to clean data in preparation for analysis and modeling.

1.  Download the [**messy_aki**](https://github.com/higgi13425/medicaldata/raw/master/data-raw/messy_data/messy_aki.xlsx) dataset from Dr. Peter Higgins' [**{medicaldata}**](https://higgi13425.github.io/medicaldata/index.html) R package.
2.  Prompt an LLM to write code to clean the data.
3.  Evaluate the results and adjust your prompt to address any missed issues.
